tasks.title: Adopt ShadCN UI toolkit and introduce design tokens
tasks.description: Refine shared UI components with ShadCN primitives and consolidate styling via a reusable design token layer.
tasks.details: 1. Evaluate current component library usage and gaps for ShadCN adoption. 2. tasks.title: Web3 multilingual unification
tasks.description: Execute the multi-phase Web3-first multilingual consolidation defined in intl.md.
tasks.details: Follow intl.md: discovery, translation architecture, Web3 layout internationalization, page migrations, QA rollout.

subtasks.title: Phase 1 – Discovery & scope lock
subtasks.description: Audit Web3 routes and confirm locale/routing scope per intl.md Phase 1.
subtasks.details: Catalog current Web3 pages/components, align target locales, define canonical routing + legacy deprecation list, deliver signed-off architecture brief.

subtasks.title: Phase 2 – Translation architecture refactor
subtasks.description: Modularize dictionaries and establish translation workflow per intl.md Phase 2.
subtasks.details: Split dictionaries by feature, define typed message APIs, add extraction tooling, document translator workflow.

subtasks.title: Phase 3 – Web3 layout internationalization
subtasks.description: Localize Web3 shell components and navigation per intl.md Phase 3.
subtasks.details: Refactor components/Web3Layout.tsx to use locale-aware config, translate shared Web3 UI strings, ensure routing helpers generate locale-prefixed links.

subtasks.title: Phase 4 – Web3 page migrations
subtasks.description: Convert Web3 pages to locale-aware implementations per intl.md Phase 4.
subtasks.details: Refactor priority pages (web3 dashboard, rewards, tasks, leaderboard, profile, fortune) to shared translation hooks, update APIs/metadata, retire duplicated /en routes.

subtasks.title: Phase 5 – QA and rollout
subtasks.description: Harden multi-locale QA, monitoring, and release workflows per intl.md Phase 5.
subtasks.details: Add locale smoke tests, visual regression coverage, deployment checklist, telemetry validation, and communication plan.
